title: Sliding Lag Problems

replies.body:
This sounds like a pretty much spot on description of something called packet loss. When your connection is coming to our servers it carries bits of data called packets. If some of those packets get lost or corrupted along the way, it causes pretty heckin' weird stuff like champions sliding around or the game seeming to pause completely. 

Grab the network logs from that match if you can and pop them into our [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743). That'll be able to tell me what your connection looked like during that game, so take a screenshot and post it back here for me!

i feel your pain, been having the same thing for two weeks since the 7.20 patch went live.

did everything that was suggested by riot themselves threw a support ticket and i was told it was networking through my IPS and to contact them.

did that too, twice, second time was all i needed to conclude that Patch 7.20 is probably causing an issue in the games that i play when logged onto league, yet all the other online games have stable ping issues. So my ISP,(after remotely ping tracing straight to riot's NA server found no issues at all), concluded with the earlier assement i had about the Patch causing the rare issue of connection and networking from my computer to their servers.

Keep in mind that the only reason i am convinced now it is the current patch is the fact that they traced the ping the same time i did while on the phone with my ISP with only one difference, my ISP does not have league downloaded on there computers for the same test i was doing and i never had a problem with the service or an entire year with my current ISP.

So yes i believe Riot needs to take responsibility for this issue and fix it.
